intro: Curcuma charanii, commonly known as the Kashmiri turmeric, is a rhizomatous plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and other aromatic herbs. The plant produces large, lance-shaped leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its rhizomes are prized for their vibrant color and aromatic properties, often used in traditional medicine and culinary practices. The botanical features of Curcuma charanii make it a unique species within the genus Curcuma.
